alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued April 07 at 11:41AM EDT until April 07 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou Maine has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Aroostook County in northern Maine... * Until 1230 PM EDT. * At 1140 AM EDT, a dangerous snow squall was located over Portage Lake, or near Portage, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and trained spotter. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes whiteout conditions and briefly snow covered roads. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Monticello and Van Buren. State Highway 11 between Masardis and Portage. Locations impacted include... Presque Isle, Caribou, Madawaska, Fort Fairfield, Limestone, Van Buren, Portage, Mapleton, Washburn, Mars Hill, Ashland, Easton, Woodland, Bridgewater, Portage Lake, Masardis, Russel Crossing, Lille, Big Machias Lake and Loring. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
